summary: TypeDoc 0.21.6 contains transitive vulnerability in marked library (CVE-2022-21681 and CVE-2022-21680) with CVSS score of 7.5, causing potential ReDoS attacks through malicious markdown input.
userImpact: Users running untrusted markdown through the documentation toolchain are vulnerable to denial of service attacks via catastrophic backtracking in regular expressions.
rootCause: Regular expressions `inline.reflinkSearch` and `block.def` in marked 2.1.3 exhibit catastrophic backtracking behavior against certain input strings.
proposedFix: Upgrade typedoc to version 0.22.11 or marked to version 4.0.10
workaround: Avoid running untrusted markdown through marked or run marked on a worker thread with a reasonable time limit to prevent resource exhaustion.
resolutionDetails: Issue was automatically closed by WhiteSource as the vulnerable library was either ignored or is no longer part of the inventory, indicating the dependency has been updated or removed.
keyQuote: Marked is a markdown parser and compiler. Prior to version 4.0.10, the regular expression may cause catastrophic backtracking and lead to a denial of service (DoS).
